item.title: Cynthia add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "To teach how to live without certainty, and yet without being paralyzed by hesitation, is perhaps the chief thing that philosophy, in our age, can still do for those who study it." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Cynthia add a quote by Kahlil Gibran
item.description: "I have learned silence from the talkative, tolerance from the intolerant and kindness from the unkind." -- Kahlil Gibran

item.title: Cynthia add a quote by Abigail Van Buren
item.description: "The best index to a person's character is how he treats people who can't do him any good, and how he treats people who can't fight back." -- Abigail Van Buren

item.title: Cynthia add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "That service is the noblest which is rendered for its own sake." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Cynthia add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "One of the strongest motives that lead men to art and science is escape from everyday life with its painful crudity and hopeless dreariness, from the fetters of one's own ever-shifting desires. A finely tempered nature longs to escape from the personal life into the world of objective perception and thought." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Cynthia add a quote by Marcus Aurelius Antoninus
item.description: "The happiness and unhappiness of the rational, social animal depends not on what he feels but on what he does; just as his virtue and vice consist not in feeling but in doing." -- Marcus Aurelius Antoninus

item.title: Cynthia add a quote by Buddha
item.description: "If we could see the miracle of a single flower clearly our whole life would change. " -- Buddha

item.title: Cynthia add a quote by Luther Standing Bear
item.description: "The old Lakota was wise. He knew that man's heart away from nature becomes hard; he knew that lack of respect for growing, living things soon led to lack of respect for humans, too." -- Luther Standing Bear

item.title: Cynthia add a quote by Marie Curie
item.description: "All my life through, the new sights of nature made me rejoice like a child." -- Marie Curie

item.title: Cynthia add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "Reality is that which, when you stop believing in it, doesn't go away." -- Philip K. Dick
